verses.verse: During that day after Jesus came out away from the house, He was sitting along the sea.
And big crowds were gathered together close to Him in such a way that for Him to be sitting down He climbed on board into the boat, and all the crowd had stood on the beach.
And He spoke many things to them in illustrations, saying, "Look, the one who seeds went out for the "to be seeding" part.
And during the time for him to be seeding, some fell along the road. And the winged birds came and ate them up.
Others fell on the rocky places where they did not have much soil, and right away they came up because of the fact for them to not be having the depth of the soil.
When the sun ascended, they were scorched and, because of the fact for them to not be having root, they shriveled up.
Others fell on the thorns, and the thorns climbed up and choked them out.
Others fell on the soil, the nice soil, and they were giving fruit: one that gave a hundred, another that gave sixty, another that gave thirty.
The person who has ears to listen must listen."
And when the students came forward, they said to Him, "Why do you speak to them in illustrations?"
When Jesus answered, He said to them, "Because it has been given to you to know the secrets of the empire of the heavens, but to those people it has not been given.
You see, anyone who has, it will be given to him, and it will overflow, but anyone who does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him.
Because of this, I speak to them in illustrations because as they see, they don't see, and as they hear, they don't hear, nor understand.

And the preaching of Isaiah (in Isaiah 6:9-10) is being fully accomplished on them, the preaching that says, 'With the hearing of the ear, you will hear and not in any way understand, and as you look, you will look and not in any way see.

You see, the heart of this ethnic group was fattened, they hardly heard with the ears, and they shut their eyes so that they would never see with the eyes, hear with the ears, understand with the heart, return back, and I would cure them.'
But your eyes are blessed because they see, and your ears because they hear.

You see, amen, I tell you that many preachers and people who did what is right desired to see things that you are looking at, and they did not see, and to hear things that you hear, and they did not hear.
So you must listen to the illustration of the one who seeds.
Everyone who hears the message of the empire and does not understand, the evil one comes and snatches up what has been seeded in his heart. This is the one who was seeded along the road.
The one seeded on the rocky places, this is the person who hears the message and right away takes it with happiness.
It does not have root in him, but it is for the time being. When hard times or persecution because of the message happens, right away he is tripped.

The one seeded into the thorns, this is the person who hears the message, and the worry of this span of time and the fraud of the wealth come together and choke off the message, and he becomes fruitless.

The one seeded on the soil, the nice soil, this is the person hearing and understanding the message, who for sure produces fruit and makes: one that makes a hundred, another that makes sixty, another that makes thirty."
He placed another illustration beside them, saying, "The empire of the heavens is like a person who seeded nice seed in his field.
During the time for the people to be sleeping, his enemy came, seeded bad wheat up in the middle of the wheat, and went away.
When the vegetation budded and produced fruit, then the bad wheat also appeared.
When the slaves of the property owner came forward, they said to him, 'Master, didn't you seed nice seed in your field? So where does it have the bad wheat from?'
The property owner was declaring to them, 'A person who is an enemy did this.' The slaves said to him, 'So do you want that after going off, we will gather them up?'
The property owner was declaring, 'No, don't, so that as you gather up the bad wheat you will not uproot the good wheat with them at the same time.

Leave both of them to be grown together up to the harvest. And at the harvest time, I will state to the harvesters, "Gather up the bad wheat first, and tie it up into bundles with the intent to burn it. But bring the good wheat together into my grain bin."'"
He placed another illustration beside them, saying, "The empire of the heavens is like a kernel of mustard that, when a person took, he seeded in his field,

that not only is littler than all of the seeds, but when it is grown, it is greater than the vegetables, and it becomes a tree in such a way for the winged birds of the sky to come and to be bedding down in its branches."
He spoke another illustration to them, "The empire of the heavens is like yeast that when a woman took, she hid in three loads of dough until the time that all of it was raised."
Jesus spoke all these things to the crowds in illustrations, and without an illustration, He was not speaking to them

in order that what was stated through the preacher (in Psalm 78:2) might be accomplished that says, "I will open my mouth in illustrations. I will utter things that have been hidden since the founding of the world."
At that time, after leaving the crowds, Jesus went into the house, and His students came to Him saying, "Define to us the illustration of the bad wheat of the field."
When Jesus answered, He said to them, "The person seeding the nice seed is the Son of the Person.
The field is the world. The nice seed, they are these people, the sons of the empire. The bad wheat are the sons of the evil one.
The enemy, the one who seeded them is the Accuser. The harvest is the very conclusion of the span of time. The harvesters are angels.
So even as the bad wheat is gathered up and burned with fire, so will it be at the very conclusion of this span of time.
The Son of the Person will send His angels out on a mission, and they will gather up from His empire all the obstacles and the people doing the crime.
And they will throw them into the furnace of the fire. There will be the crying and the grinding of the teeth there.
At that time, the people who did what is right will shine out as the sun in the empire of their Father. The person who has ears to listen must listen.

Again the empire of the heavens is like treasure that has been hidden in the field, that when a person found, he hid, and out of his happiness he goes back, sells everything, as much as he has, and buys that field.
Again the empire of the heavens is like a person, a wholesaler, looking for nice pearls,
who, when he found one very valuable pearl, after he went away, he has put everything up for sale, as much as he had, and bought it.
Again the empire of the heavens is like a seine net that was thrown into the sea and gathered some of every kind together,
that when it was filled, after they hauled it up on the beach and were seated, they gathered up the nice ones into buckets, but threw the defective ones out.
This is how it will be at the very conclusion of the span of time. The angels will go out and isolate the evil people from the middle of the people who did what is right.
And they will throw them into the furnace of the fire. There will be the crying and the grinding of the teeth there."
Jesus says to them, "Do you understand all these things?" They say to Him, "Yes, Master."

Jesus said to them, "Because of this, every Old Testament transcriber who becomes a student in the empire of the heavens is like a person, a homeowner, someone who takes out from his treasure new things and former things."
And it happened when Jesus finished these illustrations; He took off from there.
And when He went into His hometown, He was teaching them in their synagogue in such a way for them to be impressed and to be saying, "Where does this Person get this insight and the abilities from?
Isn't this the Son of the constructor? Isn't His mother called Mary and His brothers, James, Joses, Simon, and Jude?
And aren't His sisters all close to us? So where does this Person get all these things from?"
And they were being tripped up by Him. But Jesus said to them, "A preacher is not worthless except in his hometown and in his house."
And He did not show many abilities there because of their lack of trust.
